results.abstract: The screening rooms were closed. The festivals were virtual. The blockbusters were in storage. Even so, our critics found abundant and inspiring signs of cinematic life in the pandemic.
results.byline: By Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott
results.title: Best Movies of 2020

results.title: 2 Major Movies and a Life Shadowed by Pain and Perfectionism
results.abstract: Kemp Powers is the co-director of “Soul” and screenwriter of “One Night in Miami,” but his collaborators may not know just how much of himself is in those films.

results.title: How Francis Ford Coppola Got Pulled Back In to Make ‘The Godfather, Coda’
results.abstract: The director and cast, including Al Pacino, Sofia Coppola and Andy Garcia, look back at making “Part III,” which has been re-edited (and retitled) for its 30th anniversary.

multimedia.copyright: Mark Mahaney for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Over the years, Coppola has reordered and restored parts of the trilogy. But he’s now 81 and with the re-editing of “Coda” has probably put his final stamp on the series.

results.title: Elliot Page, Oscar-Nominated ‘Juno’ Star, Announces He Is Transgender
results.abstract: “Hi friends, I want to share with you that I am trans, my pronouns are he/they and my name is Elliot,” Page wrote in a statement that he posted on Tuesday.

multimedia.caption: “My joy is real, but it is also fragile,” Elliot Page wrote in a statement announcing he is transgender.

results.title: Some Movies Actually Understand Poverty in America
results.abstract: The complex realities of subsistence escape “Hillbilly Elegy.” But as far back as Charlie Chaplin’s “City Lights,” filmmakers have been turning a discerning eye on destitution.
